Posts.Content: MegMillyMo wrote: Hello, I’ve been experiencing pain in my left breast for some time, mainly when touched, when I lie on my left side and she I walk up stair or run. I don’t seem to have a lump (I don’t think) but my left breast looks incredible swollen compared to my right, it feels really hard and like there is a golf ball sized mass under my nipple. My right breast is just soft and normal, it may sound ridiculous but I’m unaware of how my breast is meant to feel. I wasn’t the one that noticed how hard my breast was s it was so my boyfriend, before then I thought nothing of the pain. I’m on only 23 years old but my auntie has recently had breast cancer which has spread. My mum also had a lump removed at point but im unaware of what this was as I haven’t told her about it the issues I’m having Any help would be appreciated, I’m yet to go to the doctor I’d just like some input. Thank you Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Painful breast but not sure if it’s a problem or not MegMillyMo MegMillyMo

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2018 04:33AM MegMillyMo wrote: thanks for the reply! I had an appointment today and have been referred for a scan. I’m absolutely terrified! My breast seems to have got bigger and is now noticeable whatever I wear, they did debate if it was my nipple piercings but because I’ve had them for so long and going of my family history they think otherwise! I’m just hoping my age is on my side, I’m only 23 so surely it can’t be anything to serious
Posts.Title: Painful breast but not sure if it’s a problem or not MegMillyMo MegMillyMo
